founding_conditions.capital: Access to up to $15M via venture/angel capital if the opportunity is clean. $8-10M readily accessible; up to $15M for compelling physical/production plays. VC/angel appetite confirmed shifting toward hard-tech/robotics/physical-economy (a16z American Dynamism, BlackRock overweight industrials, JPM supercycle broadening, Goldman $500B+ AI capex).
founding_conditions.team: 2 founders -- ML/AI Masters (Georgia Tech) + operator (Argentina native, US resident)
founding_conditions.location: Davis CA -- 1hr from SF, direct access to UC Davis ag robotics ecosystem, Central Valley specialty crop growers, CA food production cluster
founding_conditions.markets: US + LATAM lowest friction, any geography viable on economics

history.reason: v2 reset -- balanced weights, no penalty premiums
First v2 cycle -- maintained balanced weights
Expanded scope cycle -- maintained balanced weights. Physical production signals naturally score well on structural_force_magnitude and barrier_complexity dimensions.

Deepening & correction cycle. Balanced weights maintained. Counter-signals weighted equally with supporting signals. Data specificity now pulling real data (BizBuySell, SBA 504 actual terms, O*NET) rather than estimates.

running_patterns.description: Multi-Sector Baumol Cure Convergence: Healthcare, legal, accounting, insurance all releasing stored above-CPI energy simultaneously
running_patterns.cycle_3_update: O*NET data VALIDATES: Bookkeepers 85-90% routine-cognitive, Medical Records 97%, Claims Adjusters 65-75%, Paralegals 70%. Polanyi classification provides quantitative backing for Baumol Cure depth across sectors. Healthcare admin has deepest cure potential (97% automation rate).

running_patterns.description: Demographic Gap + AI Readiness Convergence: Nursing, insurance, accounting, trades, AND manufacturing aging workforce meets AI capability maturation
running_patterns.cycle_3_update: REAL DATA confirms demographic gap in manufacturing. BizBuySell: 379 CA manufacturing businesses for sale (many cite owner retirement). 77 CA food production businesses. Real retirement-sale listings found at 0.50-1.12x revenue multiples.

running_patterns.description: Regulatory Fragmentation as Structural Moat: 47+ states + EU + NAIC + HIPAA + sector-specific creating compliance maze that rewards first navigators
running_patterns.cycle_3_update: DEEPENED with counter-signals. WISeR vendor selection CLOSED -- cannot enter as vendor. But regulatory complexity STRENGTHENS moat for those already compliant. Congressional opposition to WISeR creates political risk but provider-side opportunity. AMA data (61% say AI increases denials) reinforces the arms race dynamic.

running_patterns.description: PE Distress + AI Cost Collapse Double Disruption: Refinancing wall + AI margin compression creating asset acquisition window
running_patterns.cycle_3_update: NUANCED: Tariff uncertainty SCARES PE away from manufacturing M&A = fewer competing buyers at small-business level. This creates a more favorable environment for non-PE acquirers. But 70% M&A synergy failure rate means operational capability is critical. Quality of transactions improving while volume stays low.

running_patterns.description: Jevons Expansion 3-5x in Professional Services: Unserved market consistently 3-5x current served market across accounting, legal, finance, education
running_patterns.cycle_3_update: Confirmed with unit economics: inference cost ~$0.05/month per SMB client for bookkeeping. At $149-199/month price point, 23M unserved US SMBs = massive Jevons expansion. Full-service layer gap remains open.

running_patterns.description: Robotics x AI Compound Production Cost Compression -- COGS reduction (not just SGA) in custom manufacturing, food, agriculture
running_patterns.cycle_3_update: UPGRADED to very_strong. Confirmed with REAL DATA: cobot pricing (UR5 $50K, FANUC CRX-5iA $43K), O*NET task classification (Machinists 30% routine-cognitive automatable, Food Batchmakers 30% routine-cognitive), BizBuySell targets, capital stack modeling. 5-station modernization $225-550K with 8-14 month ROI. Physical production automation is PARTIAL (enhances, doesn't replace) -- different from services where automation is COMPREHENSIVE.

running_patterns.description: Capital Allocation Rotation to Hard-Tech/Physical Economy -- VC/PE/asset managers shifting from pure-digital to physical production
running_patterns.cycle_3_update: UPGRADED to very_strong. BlackRock, JPM, AND Goldman ALL explicitly bullish on physical-economy AI. BlackRock calls humanoid robotics 'most transformative frontier.' Goldman projects $500B+ AI investment in 2026. This is the STRONGEST capital allocation consensus yet for manufacturing/robotics plays.

running_patterns.description: SBA 504 + Equipment Financing = Physical Production Capital Structure Advantage unavailable to digital businesses
running_patterns.cycle_3_update: UPGRADED to very_strong and CORRECTED. Actual SBA 504 rates: 5.67-5.91% (Feb 2026). CORRECTION: first-time buyers need 15% down (not 10%). Equipment financing 6-15%, 80-100% LTV for cobots/CNC. Capital stack MODELED: $3M acquisition + $500K modernization = $18K/month debt service, covered by $29K/month pre-modernization EBITDA. TIME-SENSITIVE: fee waiver expires Sept 30, 2026.

running_patterns.description: Christensen Three-Layer Competitive Framework -- tool layer crowding, service layer emerging, full-service layer empty across ALL professional services
running_patterns.cycle_3_update: UPGRADED to very_strong and DEEPENED with cycle 3 data. Cross-sector validation complete: tool layer crowded AND facing embedded AI commoditization (Xero/Intuit for accounting, Westlaw for legal, EHRs for healthcare). Service layer emerging (Basis, Docyt for accounting; Lawhive, Garfield for legal; HealthSpark, Verse for healthcare). Full-service layer remains EMPTY across all sectors. CORRECTION: Legal service layer filling FAST (Lawhive $60M). Accounting service layer sparse but emerging. Healthcare hyper-specialized (no horizontal platform). The full-service layer for simple use cases is THE gap.

running_patterns.description: Silver Tsunami Acquisition Window -- 2.34M boomer businesses, $10T transfer, 58% with no succession plan = 5-10 year acquisition window
running_patterns.cycle_3_update: CONFIRMED with REAL DATA. BizBuySell: 379 CA manufacturing + 77 food production businesses for sale. Many cite owner retirement. EBITDA multiples 3.2-4x for retirement sales (vs 10x+ for healthy mid-market). Revenue multiples 0.50-1.12x. Specific CNC shops and food producers identified with $1-3M acquisition prices. The acquisition window is open NOW.

running_patterns.description: NEW: Embedded AI Commoditizing Tool Layer -- Xero/Intuit, Westlaw/Lexis, EHR vendors adding AI natively, threatening standalone AI tool companies
running_patterns.detail: NEW PATTERN identified in cycle 3. Major platform vendors (Intuit, Xero, Westlaw, Lexis, eClinicalWorks) embedding AI into existing products. This commoditizes the standalone AI tool layer. Accounting Today: tech stack consolidation = accountants want fewer tools, not more. AI accounting market growing at 44.6% CAGR but shifting from standalone to embedded. IMPLICATION: Tool-layer AI startups face commoditization. Service layer and full-service layer are the durable positions.

running_patterns.description: NEW: Provider-Side Healthcare AI Arms Race -- WISeR/payer AI triggers counter-demand for provider-side AI to fight denials
running_patterns.detail: NEW PATTERN: CMS WISeR model deploys AI on the payer side for prior auth. AMA reports 61% of physicians say AI increases denials. This creates DEMAND for provider-side AI: practices need tools to fight AI-powered denials, optimize submissions, and navigate the new system. The arms race dynamic (payer AI vs. provider AI) creates structural demand on BOTH sides. Provider-side aligned with physician interests = better market reception.

tier_1.name: SMB Accounting/Finance (Full-Service Layer)
tier_1.cycle_3_change: Score -1. Service layer no longer empty (Basis, Docyt). Full-service layer remains empty. Unit economics modeled: $0.05/month inference per client.

tier_1.name: Healthcare Admin AI (Provider-Side)
tier_1.cycle_3_change: Score -2, REFRAMED. WISeR vendor selection closed. Provider-side opportunity strengthened. Horizontal platform across practice types = gap.

tier_1.name: Robotics x AI Manufacturing Acquisition
tier_1.cycle_3_change: Score +1, CONFIRMED. Real BizBuySell data. Capital stack modeled. Debt service covered from day 1.

tier_1.name: Specialty Food/Beverage Production AI + Robotics
tier_1.cycle_3_change: Score +2, PROMOTED from Tier 2. Real listings confirm. Wholesale bakery unit economics modeled. BEST FIT for robotics x AI.

tier_1.name: Insurance Claims AI (SMB/TPA)
tier_1.cycle_3_change: Score -3. 4% scaling rate = implementation harder than expected. 70% customer mistrust. Still viable for SMB/TPA layer.

tier_2.name: AI-First Legal Services (SMB Corporate Niche)
tier_2.cycle_3_change: DEMOTED from Tier 1. Score -7. Lawhive $60M Series B closes service layer gap. Remaining niche: SMB corporate legal.

tier_2.name: PE Distress Cascade
tier_2.cycle_3_change: Score -1. Tariffs scare PE = fewer competing buyers. Favorable for non-PE acquirers. 70% M&A failure rate is key risk.

tier_2.name: AI Regulatory Compliance
tier_2.cycle_3_change: Score unchanged. Regulatory landscape continues deepening.

tier_2.name: US-LATAM AI Services + Manufacturing
tier_2.cycle_3_change: Score unchanged. Expansion market for any Tier 1 play.

tier_2.name: Precision Agriculture (Davis CA)
tier_2.cycle_3_change: Score -3. OEM competition (Deere, CNH, AGCO), seasonal revenue, capital intensity. Specialty crop niche valid but longer timeline.

tier_3.name: Capital Allocation Rotation (validation signal)
tier_3.cycle_3_change: Score +2. Strongest consensus yet: BlackRock/JPM/Goldman all bullish on physical AI.

monitoring.name: Perez Turning Point
monitoring.note: Goldman $527B hyperscaler capex deepens overhang. Build crash-resilient.

monitoring.name: Government/Municipal Services AI
monitoring.note: Large Baumol sector, unclear regulatory path. Under-explored.

monitoring.name: Mental Health / Therapy AI
monitoring.note: Regulatory moat forming (Utah first law). Under-explored.

monitoring.name: Real Estate Transaction AI
monitoring.note: Large market, competitive density unknown. Under-explored.

barriers_noted.status: Commoditizing (OpenAI, Hathr.ai) -- moat shifting to EHR integration
UPL enforcement tightening in several states
Consumer/SMB service layer filling fast. Remaining niche: SMB corporate legal.
NEW: commoditizes tool layer, validates service/full-service focus
Few can do it well, creates service moat

barriers_noted.barrier: OEM competition in precision ag (Deere, CNH, AGCO)
barriers_noted.status: NEW: billions in R&D budgets. Specialty crop niche is defense.
NEW: operational capability is the differentiator
NEW: cannot enter as WISeR vendor. Provider-side opportunity remains.
NEW: 95% accuracy requirement. Human-in-loop is feature not bug.
NEW: scares PE but fewer competing buyers = positive for individual acquirers
NEW: slow adoption. First to build trust wins.

transmission_chains.note: Goldman $527B capex in 2026. Raw inference cost $0.05/month per SMB client. Application economics deeply viable. Overhang deepening.
Tool-layer saturating AND facing embedded AI commoditization. Service layer emerging. Full-service layer is the frontier. Christensen three-layer validated cross-sector.
CMS WISeR reframed: vendor selection closed, but provider-side opportunity strengthened. 97% medical records automation rate. Arms race dynamic creating demand on BOTH sides.
Advanced from N3-N4 to N4. Real BizBuySell targets, modeled capital stacks, confirmed cobot pricing. Deloitte: 50% AI adoption growth in manufacturing. Still early for SME deployment.
CONFIRMED at N5 with real data. 379 CA manufacturing + 77 food production businesses for sale. Retirement sales at 0.50-1.12x revenue. Window is open NOW.
Advanced from N3. BlackRock/JPM/Goldman ALL bullish on physical AI. Strongest consensus yet. Downstream effects materializing.
Unchanged. Factory automation market growing. Expansion market.
WISeR + NAIC model law + Colorado AI Act + 250+ state bills. Political risk (congressional WISeR repeal) but overall trajectory is more regulation, not less.
Goldman $527B capex confirms installation phase still running. Application-layer businesses (deployment phase) are highest conviction.
NEW chain. Platform vendors embedding AI into existing products. Tool layer facing structural threat. Service/full-service layers insulated.
NEW chain. WISeR triggers payer-side AI, which triggers demand for provider-side AI. AMA data confirms physician opposition to payer AI. Provider-side tools aligned with physician interests.

agent_a.cycle_3_note: DEEPENING cycle. 10 counter-signals (2+ per Tier 1). Real data: BizBuySell listings, SBA 504 terms, O*NET task decomposition, cobot pricing, competitive density mapping. Counter-signals treated with equal rigor as supporting signals.

agent_b.cycle_3_note: First CORRECTION cycle. Scores moved both UP (Food +2, Manufacturing +1) and DOWN (Legal -7, Insurance -3, Healthcare -2, Precision Ag -3, Accounting -1). Capital stacks modeled with real terms. Unit economics built for top targets. Food promoted to Tier 1. Legal demoted to Tier 2.

RESOLVED: 6 vendors identified (Cohere, Genzeon, Humata, Innovaccer, Virtix, Zyter). Vendor selection is CLOSED. Provider-side opportunity reframed.

RESOLVED: UR5 $50K, FANUC CRX-5iA $43K. Total per-station $35-90K. 5-station modernization $225-550K.

key_unknowns_resolved.unknown: Manufacturing EBITDA multiples for retirement sales
key_unknowns_resolved.resolution: RESOLVED: 3.2-4x EBITDA for retirement sales. Revenue multiples 0.50-1.12x in CA.
RESOLVED: 6-15% rates, 80-100% LTV, 3-7 year terms. Equipment is collateral.

Real estate AI competitive density -- how crowded is this market? (under-explored)
next_cycle_suggestions: PRIORITY 1: Customer discovery interviews -- 5-10 conversations across top opportunities: (a) retiring manufacturer owners, (b) independent physician practices struggling with prior auth, (c) SMBs without CPAs. Nothing beats talking to customers.

PRIORITY 2: Specific CNC/food acquisition target shortlisting -- narrow from 379/77 listings to 5-10 actionable targets using criteria: owner retirement, $1-3M revenue, $300K+ EBITDA, existing equipment, customer contracts.
PRIORITY 3: SBA 504 CDC relationship -- establish contact with Statewide CDC. Understand actual approval process and timeline for first-time manufacturing acquirer.
PRIORITY 4: Competitive deep-dive on Lawhive -- US expansion plans, geographic coverage, practice areas. Determine if SMB corporate legal niche is defensible or Lawhive will expand into it.
PRIORITY 5: Provider-side healthcare AI prototype specification -- define MVP for prior auth navigation tool for independent practices.
PRIORITY 6: CPA licensing pathway in CA post-AB 1175 -- understand specific requirements for operating an AI-first accounting practice.
PRIORITY 7: Cobot integration partner identification in CA -- which companies can do 3-6 month modernization of acquired manufacturer?
PRIORITY 8: Stress test the BEST opportunity -- pick the #1 candidate and run a full bear case. What would have to be true for this to FAIL?
